refnamediv.refpurpose: initialise a repmgr installation and register the primary node

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: repmgr primary register registers a primary node in a streaming replication cluster, and configures it for use with &repmgr;, including installing the &repmgr; extension. This command needs to be executed before any standby nodes are registered.

note.para: &repmgr; will attempt to install the &repmgr; extension as part of this command, however this will fail if the repmgr user is not a superuser.
It's possible to install the &repmgr; extension manually before executing repmgr primary register; in this case &repmgr; will detect the presence of the extension and skip that step.

refsect1.title: Execution
refsect1.para: Execute with the --dry-run option to check what would happen without actually registering the primary.

note.para: If providing the configuration file location with -f/--config-file, avoid using a relative path, as &repmgr; stores the configuration file location in the repmgr metadata for use when &repmgr; is executed remotely (e.g. during ). &repmgr; will attempt to convert the a relative path into an absolute one, but this may not be the same as the path you would explicitly provide (e.g. ./repmgr.conf might be converted to /path/to/./repmgr.conf, whereas you'd normally write /path/to/repmgr.conf).

refsect1.para: repmgr master register can be used as an alias for repmgr primary register.

refsect1.title: User permission requirements
refsect1.para: The repmgr user must be a superuser in order for &repmgr; to be able to install the repmgr extension.
If this is not the case, the repmgr extension can be installed manually before executing repmgr primary register.
A future &repmgr; release will enable the provision of a --superuser name for the installation of the extension.

listitem.para: Check prerequisites but don't actually register the primary.

refsect1.title: Event notifications
refsect1.para:
Following event notifications will be generated:
cluster_created
primary_register
